name: Tutorial
description: 3-5 minute horizontal tutorial/how-to video with step-by-step instructions. Chapter markers, clear visuals for each step, and detailed narration. Great for educational content, how-to guides, and course modules.

config.structure: intro → prerequisites → step_1 → step_2 → step_3 → step_N → result → recap
config.notes: Each step must be self-contained and visually demonstrable. Number the steps explicitly.

config.style_notes: Clean, instructional style. Use consistent color scheme. Each step gets a numbered title overlay. Show both the action and the result.

config.notes: Generate clear, instructional keyframes. Diagrams, UI mockups, or illustrative scenes. Avoid overly artistic styles — clarity > aesthetics.
Tutorial clips need subtle, controlled motion — pointer movement, highlight animations, gentle zooms. Not cinematic motion.
Narration is primary — BGM should be barely noticeable. Pacing slightly slower than short-form content.

structure.purpose: What you'll learn + why it matters. Set expectations.
What you need before starting. Tools, materials, prior knowledge.
Numbered steps, each with: what to do → how to do it → what you should see.
Show the final result. Compare before/after if applicable.
Quick summary of all steps + common mistakes to avoid + CTA.

example_prompts: Use the "Tutorial" template to make a video about "How to set up a Next.js project from scratch"
Tutorial template: "5 steps to create a professional resume in Canva" for job seekers
Make a tutorial video: "How to brew the perfect pour-over coffee" — beginner level, 3 minutes
example_topics: How to set up a Next.js project from scratch
5 steps to create a professional resume in Canva
How to brew the perfect pour-over coffee
Setting up a home NAS with Raspberry Pi
How to create a budget spreadsheet in Google Sheets
tips: Number every step clearly — both in narration and as visual overlays
Show the expected result after each step, not just at the end
Use chapter markers/timestamps — they improve YouTube SEO and viewer retention
Keep each step under 45 seconds — if a step is longer, break it into sub-steps
Add a 'common mistakes' section — it's the most valuable part for learners and boosts watch time
